item.title: President Monson Gratitude
item.description: Do material possessions make us happy and grateful? Perhaps momentarily. However, those things which provide deep and lasting happiness and gratitude are the things which money cannot buy: our families, the gospel, good friends, our health.

item.title: President Monson The Christmas Spirit
item.description: True love is a reflection of the Savior’s love. In December of each year we call it the Christmas spirit. You can hear it. You can see it. You can feel it.

item.title: The First Christmas Spirit
item.description: What would it have been like to raise Jesus Christ? Joseph was a humble carpenter when God gave him the responsibility of being Christ’s father.

item.title: A Savior Is Born—Christmas Video
item.description: A Savior is born. Each Christmas season we celebrate the birth of our Savior—the Son of God, who can save us from sin and sadness. Remember Him, love Him, and follow Him. Visit christmas.mormon.org

item.title: Why we need a Savior — A Christmas message about our Savior Jesus Christ. #ASaviorIsBorn.
item.description: What would life be like without a Savior? There would be no joy, no forgiveness, no hope for the future. This Christmas, learn more about the hope, peace and happiness our Savior Jesus Christ can bring into our lives at christmas.mormon.org.

item.title: He Is The Gift
item.description: The first gift of Christmas was a simple gift given by a father to all his children, to us. He gave us his son, the Christ. He is the gift. This Christmas season, how will you share the gift? http://www.christmas.mormon.org

item.title: What Shall We Give? - Christmas Music Video
item.description: In the midst of the holiday hustle and bustle, the Mormon Tabernacle Choir shares this modern take on the age-old question "What Shall We Give?" to the babe in the manger, to Christ the King of Kings.

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: Mary conceives by the power of the Holy Ghost – Heavenly messengers herald the birth of Jesus in Bethlehem.

item.title: The Reason Behind Christmas
item.description: This Christmas season, give the gift Jesus Christ wants us to give; the gift of ourselves. Amid the shopping and commercialism, focus on the reason we're celebrating and remember to keep Christ in Christmas.

item.title: Temple Square
item.description: Temple Square, in Salt Lake City, Utah, is home to administrative offices, museums and historic sites of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Good Tidings of Great Joy: The Birth of Jesus Christ
item.description: Share the good tidings of great joy: that He lives!

item.title: Christmas Is Love
item.description: Christmas . . . is the time we realize most deeply that the more love is expended, the more there is of it for others.

item.title: O Little Town Of Bethlehem
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “O Little Town of Bethlehem.”

item.title: The Perfect Gift
item.description: The Spirit can lead each of us in many and simple ways to give love, faith, and joy to others at this season of rejoicing.

item.title: What Child Is This?
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “What Child Is This?”

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: The Christmas season is a time to celebrate the priceless gift of our our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. His birth is more than the symbol of a holiday. He is the Son of God and the Redeemer of all mankind. mormon.org/Christmas

item.title: They Gave Up Their Christmas
item.description: Just as the wise men of old gave the Christ child gifts, members of a congregation in California offer service in a vineyard on Christmas day.

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples.

item.title: The Wise Men Seek Jesus
item.description: The Wise Men present Jesus with gifts—gold, frankincense, and myrrh. After their visit, Mary and Joseph flee to Egypt to protect Jesus from the wicked King Herod, who wishes to kill the child.

item.title: Our Christmas Story Tree
item.description: Music Video - Our Christmas Story Tree

item.title: Wise Men Still Seek Him
item.description: Three modern-day wise men show us that the greatest gift we can give Jesus Christ is the will of our hearts.

item.title: The Christ Child Is Presented at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph take Jesus to the temple, where the righteous Simeon blesses the baby and rejoices that the Lord let him live to see this day.

item.title: Shepherds Learn of the Birth of Christ
item.description: The angel Gabriel announces the birth of Jesus to the shepherds. The shepherds then visit Mary, Joseph, and the newborn Jesus.

item.title: Mary and Joseph Travel to Bethlehem
item.description: Traveling to their ancestral city of Bethlehem, Mary and Joseph are unable to find a room in an inn. Instead, they find shelter in a place where animals are kept.

item.title: Mary and Elisabeth Rejoice Together
item.description: Mary visits her relative Elisabeth, who in her old age will also soon give birth to a miraculous child. The women rejoice together.

item.title: The Coat
item.description: The Coat is a children’s story that depicts a young boy giving selflessly to another child in need.

item.title: Silent Night
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir and congregation sing "Silent Night."

item.title: Because He Came
item.description: There is no better time than now, this very Christmas season, for all of us to rededicate ourselves to the principles taught by Jesus Christ.

item.title: A Gift to the World
item.description: A video presentation titled “A Gift to the World,” shown as part of the First Presidency Christmas Devotional.

item.title: The Gifts of Christmas
item.description: You can give a great and wonderful Christmas if you remember the gifts God has given you and, as best you can, offer them to others as He would.

item.title: Of Curtains, Contentment, and Christmas
item.description: If we are only willing to open our hearts and minds to the spirit of Christmas, we will recognize wonderful things happening around us that will direct or redirect our attention to the sublime.

item.title: The First Noel
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings "The First Noel."

item.title: Joy to the World
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings "Joy to the World."

item.title: First Presidency Christmas Devotional
item.description: The 2011 First Presidency Christmas Devotional with music provided by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir and the Orchestra at Temple Square.

item.title: An Angel Foretells Christ’s Birth to Mary
item.description: The angel Gabriel, sent from the presence of God, announces to the young Mary her future role as the mother of the child Jesus.

item.title: Madera Volunteers
item.description: Each year, volunteers from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints harvest over 300,000 pounds of raisins from the Madera vineyard. These raisins are donated to the poor and needy all over the world.

item.title: Kids and Christmas
item.description: Christmas is a time when we can all learn from a child's gratitude and love for Jesus Christ. See the meaning and the story of Christmas through the eyes of children.

item.title: Look to the Light
item.description: At Christmastime and always, Jesus Christ is the Light of the World for all who seek Him.

item.title: The Greatest Gift
item.description: On Christmas morning, amid presents and torn wrappings, a young man gets a reminder of the greatest gift of all.

item.title: A Bright Shining Star
item.description: This joyful season brings to all of us a measure of happiness that corresponds to the degree to which we have turned our minds, feelings, and actions to the Savior, whose birth we celebrate.

item.title: Oh, Come, All Ye Faithful
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings "Oh, Come, All Ye Faithful."

item.title: The Gift of a Savior
item.description: Each act of kindness to anyone becomes a kindness to Him because He loves all of Heavenly Father’s children. And because that brings joy to Him, it also brings joy to His Father, to whom we owe thanks beyond measure.

item.title: What Shall We Give?
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings "What Shall We Give?"

item.title: Seeing Christmas through New Eyes
item.description: We celebrate the birth of the Son of God, the Creator, our Messiah. We rejoice that the King of kings came to earth, was born in a manger, and lived a perfect life.

item.title: It Came upon the Midnight Clear
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings "It Came upon the Midnight Clear."

item.title: Hark! The Herald Angels Sing
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings "Hark! The Herald Angels Sing."

item.title: Matt and Mandy, December 2010
item.description: Matt and Mandy share peace with others.

item.title: The First Christmas Gift
item.description: (Based on a true story) For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son (John 3:16).

item.title: The Christmas Spirit
item.description: A young girl with true Christmas spirit quietly teaches her preoccupied family the true meaning of Christmas.

item.title: Matt and Mandy, December 2009
item.description: Matt and Mandy celebrate Christmas by rejoicing in the birth of Jesus Christ.

item.title: A Gift for Jesus
item.description: Jane McBride Choate, “A Gift for Jesus,” Friend, Dec. 2009, 18–19 (Based on a true story)

item.title: Showing Our Love for Jesus
item.description: Jane McBride Choate, “Showing Our Love for Jesus,” Friend, Dec. 2008, 16–17 (Based on a true story) For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord (Luke 2:11).

item.title: Matt and Mandy, December 2008
item.description: Matt and Mandy talk about the meaning of Christmas.
